name.text: Q1. Air shipments and KPI impact

questiontext.text: When the share of Air shipments increases from 15% to 40%, which KPI is most affected?

feedback.text: Correct: Air mode shortens lead time but increases cost.

name.text: Q2. SLA reduction effect on OTIF

questiontext.text: If the SLA for Road shipments is reduced from 6 to 5 days, what happens to OTIF?

feedback.text: Correct: Stricter SLA reduces OTIF as fewer shipments meet the target.

name.text: Q3. Effect of random cost variation

questiontext.text: Adding ±20% random variation to transport cost mainly affects which aspect?

feedback.text: Correct: Randomness affects variance, not mean values.

questiontext.text: Capping all lead times at 10 days results in:

feedback.text: Correct: Shorter lead times mean more shipments fall within SLA limits.

questiontext.text: Introducing “Rail” as a new mode between Road and Sea likely causes:

answer.text: Balanced trade-off between cost and speed

feedback.text: Correct: Rail balances time and cost between Road and Sea.
